result:
Food waste

This lever sets the amount of calories wasted at the consumer level and comes expressed in kcal/cap/day.

For 2012, food waste for the whole EU-28 was estimated at 88 million tonnes (Stenmarck et al., 2017). This equates to 173 kilograms of food waste per person. The total amount of food produced in the EU for 2011 was estimated at 865 kg/person, this would mean a 20% waste of the total food produced.

An overall reduction in daily calories of food wasted, with all other variables kept constant, would lead to a reduction in carbon emissions from the agricultural sector.

  • Ambition Level 1

    For level 1 food waste at the consumer level follows historical patterns of increased demand and therefore more food waste.

  • Ambition Level 2

    Level 2 is set as the arithmetic average between level 1 and 3.

  • Ambition Level 3

    For level 3 it is assumed that by 2050 countries will achieve a 50% food waste reduction at the consumer level, thus complying with Sustainable Development Goal (SDG) target 12.3 (set for 2030).

  • Ambition Level 4

    For level 4 countries achieve a 75% food waste reduction at the consumer level by 2050.

For more details on the definition of the ambition levels for this lever and on the context and modelling assumptions, please refer to the technical documentation.
